column4: Hmm... not quite sure what I'm looking for in the listed process, but nothing seems to contain "firefox"
Hmm... I think I'll have to reinstall again
Thanks everyone
try ps aux | grep firefox
reboot and reinstall *g*
restored my bookmarks, but then bookmark-organizing library is empty, even though the drop down menu shows bookmarks
so I tried to delete ******.defaults files in firefox profile folder
the folder is something like ~/.mozilla/firefox (found info online)
xxxx.default is your profile
yeah, it was suggested on some pages that several bookmark issues are related to the profile
so I tried to delete that
then for some reason, i thought it would be good to complete remove and reinstall firefox at that point :(
removing firefox wont remove your profile
yeah, that i figured out from trial and error :P
hmm I only backup bookmarks with Xmarks
yeah, the profile resides in .mozilla/firefox or so
yikes @@~
I might consider giving up on firefox for good, and finally try chrome. This is actually the second time
I copied my firefox profile from windows to linux and the other way around, I just put it in the profile folder and changed the file profile.ini or whats it called
that it's happenedn, I don't remember what I did last time though
sometimes the problems start with wrong permissions on the profile
